DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to increase colorectal cancer screening by implementing a community-wide shared decision-making (SDM) intervention, which embeds shared decision making within clinical practice and also uses an extensive community engagement campaign. The investigators hypothesize that colorectal cancer screening adherence will be higher in the intervention group (participating communities) compared to the usual care control group (non-participating comparison communities).
DOC.brief_title: Colorectal Cancer Screening With Improved Shared Decision Making
DOC.detailed_description: Clinical practice: All patients 50-75 years seen in the participating primary care clinics during the study period who are non-adherent to CRCS recommendation. This sample is anticipated to be N~50,000 patients. Community engagement: Includes mailed questionnaires to age-eligible adults residing in intervention and comparison (control) communities (N=2150).
